ftbquests.chapter.data.title: FTB Skies
ftbquests.chapter.air_bending_and_you.qu: It all starts here. By making reinforced stone you can create a material strong enough to withstand high pressures.
Pushing Pressure
&bPressure tubes&r carry &6compressed air&r. If the pressure inside it reaches 5.0 bar it will explode.

Air pressure also takes time to build up and change, it isnt transferred instantly. Air pressure also &6relies on a closed system&r, it will escape from open pipe connections, which will lower the pressure in the system. Right clicking on a connection with a &6Pneumatic Wrench&r will close that section.

In order to generate compressed air you'll first use a &6Rotational Compressor&r. This will convert Stress Units (SU) from your create producers into Air Pressure. The Rotational Compressor is capable of producing up to 5.0 Bar of pressure, making it ideal for most things you'll currently need.
Later you will be able to make a Flux Compressor to produce much more.

Remember to avoid overpressurizing your system. A Safety Valve can prevent this by placing it on a pressure tube near your rotational compressor but a better solution may come from using a guage to turn off your compressor whenever it isnt needed.
&bAir Pressure&r is what powers most Pneumaticcraft machines. It is &6measured in bars&r. The more bars, the higher the pressure.
Air moves from high-pressure areas to low-pressure areas and will try to equalize throughout the system.
If the air pressure in a machine or tube is higher than it can support the &cmachine will explode&r!
PneumaticCraft machines and tools all have a specific &6volume&r (measured in ML) that represents how much air they hold at 0 bar. This can be increased with Volume upgrades.
Machines use compressed air to operate, which constantly lowers pressure in the system as they consume it.
Make sure to &6read the PNC:R Manual&r for more information.
Air Pressure
Thermodynamics
&bHeat&r is another mechanic unique to Pneumaticcraft.&6 Heat disperses&r to adjacent blocks, including air.
If certain heat sources have their heat dispersed entirely, it can &6convert to a different block&r. An example of this would be using lava to heat a machine and it eventually cooling to obsidian.
You can prevent heat from dissipating in the air by making sure the block is covered by any block that isnt air. &6Thermal Lagging&r works well for this.

Some operations are endothermic (Heat Using) while others may be exothermic (Heat Producing). This will depend on the machine and recipe so be sure to look at the recipe and plan your heat management accordingly.

An important note is that since these machines share heat it is often useful to put multiple machines that require similar temperatures touching each other to make heat management easier. You can pipe between them with &6dispenser upgrades&r.

As PNC has compatibility with other mods, a great source of heat is blaze burners or liquid blaze burners. If you give a blaze burner a straw you can pipe in diesel or other burnable liquids for high heat production at low cost.
Later game when you can generate Mekanism heat, it will also work!
The &bVortex Tube&r uses compressed air to &6make one side cold and the other side hot&r.
The higher the airflow, the more extreme the temperature difference will be.
A &bThermopneumatic Processing Plant&r is used to process liquids into other liquids.
LPG and Coal together in this machine can produce &6Liquid Plastic&r.
It can also be used in fuel cracking.
Heavy fuels can be cracked into lighter ones. This means &6Diesel&r can be turned into &6Kerosene&r, which can turn into Gasoline and then further into LPG.
The &bFluid Mixer&r mixes two fluids, as the name would imply. It can make either an item or another fluid.
One significant use for this is producing &6Biodiesel&r, which is the corner stone of your enhanced power production.
The &bCharging Station&r allows you to &6fill items with compressed air&r, allowing them to work.
It will only fill items to have equal pressure that the Charging Station itself has.
If the item has higher pressure than the Charging Station, it will &6empty itself back into the network&r.
The &bCharging Module&r can be placed on a pressure tube and it will charge all items in the inventory it's facing.
It can also discharge them if their pressure exceeds the Tube's. If you put these on two connected Ender Chests you can effectively &6teleport air pressure&r!
The Camouflage Applicator can make camouflageable blocks such as tubes and heat pipes look like other blocks.
Sneak + Right Click the applicator on a block (like grass or diamond) then click on any camouflageable block to set its appearance.
The Minigun will shoot Minigun Ammo using compressed air by holding right-click.
Sneak click the minigun to insert up to 4 Minigun ammo boxes. Minigun Ammo can be combined with a potion to apply its effects on hit.
You can install several useful upgrades to the minigun in the charging station to improve its functionality.
Speed upgrades can go in most PNC Machines and makes them operate faster but consume more air pressure.

You'll need the PCB blueprint in order to make the UV lightbox and PCBs. In order to obtain it you'll need to find someone with specialized knowledge of the processor. Seek out a villager at a sky village and give them a charging station for their job to convert them into an engineer.
&6{block.pneumaticcraft.uv_light_box}&r is needed to get the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r ready for the Etching Tank.
The longer the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r are in the &6{block.pneumaticcraft.uv_light_box}&r, the higher chance of success.
Fill this with &6Etching&r Acid and insert &bEmpty PCB&r's which have been exposed in a &6UV Light Box&r.
Can optionally be heated above
50C° for progressively faster etching (but Etching Acid will be slowly used when heated)
If you want to automate this you can extract Unassembled PCB's from the sides, and Failed PCB's
from the top/bottom.

Slapping some &3{item.pneumaticcraft.transistor}s&r and &3{item.pneumaticcraft.capacitor}s&r on the &6{item.pneumaticcraft.unassembled_pcb}&r will finally yield the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.printed_circuit_board}&r
Assembly Line

The &bAssembly Line&r is a multiblock machine allowing the crafting of precision recipes. All parts of the assembly line must touch and pressure needs to be provided to the controller. Additionally, a &bprogram must be inserted&r into the assembly controller. Most recipes will use the laser program but the drill as well as the combination drill and laser are needed for some.
&bAssembly IO Units&r control the input and output of the recipes. They must be able to reach an inventory, such as a chest, and the assembly platform. They can reach anything with a 3x3 area.
I am (Compressed) Iron Man!

Pneumatic Armor, though it has fairly low defense at the start, can be extensively upgraded. These upgrades can give it more armor, toughness, speed, flight, nightvision and more! The Chestpiece can also be upgraded to charge all of your pneumatic devices.
This armor does not have infinite durability like some other tech armors but can be upgraded to automatically repair with pressure.
Advanced Pressure Tubes
Advanced pressure tubes can handle up to 25 Bar and 4 times the volume. Be careful that the machines you connect these to can handle the pressure or use a regulator.

The &bAerial Interface&r, when pressurized, &nexposes your inventory as if were in a chest&r. Any items inserted into the interface enter your inventory instead. Your main inventory is accessed from any horizontal side while your armor is the top face. This can be changed in the UI.

Having this setup also provides &6water breathing&r, at an additional air pressure cost. If you provide it with FE it will also &6wirelessly charge all your items&r! A dispenser upgrade will &6automatically eat for you&r as well as allow you to pipe experience in and out.
This can be used to keep your chestplate charged and your chestplate can be upgraded to charge all other PNC armors and items.

&bHeat sinks&r can help to more quickly dissipate heat from a block they are touching. Any heat sinks over or under 60/-60C will hurt you if you touch them. The effectiveness can be greatly increased by using an air grate to vent air over the fin. These used in conjunction with vortex tubes should be able to effectively handle all of your heating and cooling requirements.
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.title: Armor + Weapons
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests0: Isn't it weird to think that everything is so unstable?
Like, we all believe in the magic of technology; it feels so permanent but, just like that, it's gone.
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests1: Manasteel Armor
&eBotania&r offers 3 Tiers of Armor. The first one being the &bManasteel Armor&r
This offers you the same armor as Iron Armor does, but it comes with the benefit of reduced Mana Cost when using Botania Tools
Also, this Armor can be repaired with Mana
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests2: Elementium Armor
After tossing some &6Manasteel&r into the Elven Portal and you will obtain some &bElementium&r
This can be used to make some better Armor
In addition to the effects of &6Manasteel Armor&r, the &bElementium Armor&r also spawns Pixies when you are getting attacked
Random Rune
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests3: As final tier of Armor from &eBotania&r we have the &bTerrasteel Armor Set&r
This gives various buffs to the player, which are all located in the tooltip of the Armor
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests4: I'm sure you'll be able to make one of these.
I'd be concerned if you can't!
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests5: You just... have to craft it, don't let the &6Unstable Ingots&r explode
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests6: An upgraded Sword compared to the &6Manasteel Sword&r
It does the same amount of base damage, but in addition it has a chance to spawn Pixies when hitting entities
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests7: Your magical counterpart to an &6Iron Sword&r
This &bManasteel Sword&r does have the benefit, that it can easily be repaired with Mana
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests8: A somewhat cheap sword that uses RF instead of durability!
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests9: May the Force be with you!
&eForceCraft&r offers it's own Tools and Weapons which can be enhanced with a &6Force Infuser&r. If you craft a &bForce Sword&r you get the Infuser for free
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests1: Have you tried Terraria yet?
Inspired by Terraria, the &eBotania&r Developer added the Terra Blade
This Sword has the same damage value as a &6Diamond Sword&r but, it also shoots out a Mana Burst
Only those as powerful as vazkii can wield such a sword
So uh... Everyone who crafts it.
Force Armor
\"Hello there!\" - General Kenobi
Crafting this &bForce Armor&r may, or may not show you the Jedi's way
As &2Yoda&r likes to say
&o“Adventure. Excitement. A Jedi craves not these things.”&r
Luckily, you aren't a Jedi.
Flux-Infused Armor
Using &6Flux-Infused Gems&r to create these powerful Armor allows you to power it up with &6Forge Energy
This will make it more durable and give better defense.
Be sure to recharge it from time to time!
Vanilla Armor
Good Ol' Vanilla
In most packs, you start off with some basic &bArmor&r
&eFTB Skies&r is no exception. Craft some &bVanilla Armor&r and reap your rewards
Vanilla Helmets
Vanilla Chestplate
Vanilla Leggings
Vanilla Boots
Generic Armors
Various Mods, like &eCyclic and Thermal Expansion&r offer their own set of &bArmor&r
Might be worth a shot to check them out!
Modded Helmets
Modded Chestplates
Modded Leggings
Modded Boots
Modded Swords
Various Mods, like &eCyclic and Thermal Expansion&r offer their own set of &bTools and Weapons&r
Might be worth a shot to check them out!
Enchanting in &dFTB Skies&r is quite a bit different, thanks to &eApotheosis&r
There are many new mechanics, which you can read about in &6Chronicles of Shadows&r
ftbquests.chapter.armor__weapons.quests2: The &bSalvaging Table&r will allow you to break down rarity material into a lower tier or get gem dust.
Depending on the item you will get back some components based on the rarity of the item destroyed.
You can use this to refine the material into new affixes in the &6Reforging Table&r. To get new rarity materials of higher tier you will have to loot them.
Random Gem

The &bReforging Table&r allows you to imbue any weapon or armor with the apotheotic forged powers. This will allow you to create or recreate affix properties on any valid item. The type of affix that is applied will depend on the rarity of the materials you use to forge the item.
The process also requires some amount of gem dust which is obtained when dropping an anvil on gems.
It should be noted that while I can continue reforging to get an affix I like, the forging process is irreversible.
&bEquipment Tomes&r can be enchanted like Books, but &6only accept enchantments of a specific type&r.
Only Boot Enchantments can go on the Tome of Boots, etc.
The &bTome of Scrapping&r can be combined with an enchanted item in the Anvil to destroy it, &6removing half of the enchantments&r onto a new Book.
Equipment Tomes
The &bSocket Sigil&r is a magic tool that allows me to &6add Gem Sockets to tools&r.
You &6can reroll&r, but rerolling &ccan go down instead of up&r.
Using the &bGem Cutting Table&r allows you to refine &6Gem Dust and Rarity Materials&r into new Gems
Where to store all my books!?
The &bEnchantment Library&r is a block that stores &6Echantments&r. Inserting an enchanted book will deposit it.
Left—clicking on a stored enchantment will extract one level of it. Shift—clicking will extract the max level available.
Random Bookshelf
Splitting the &mAtoms&r Enchantments
Using the &6Splitting&r enchant on an &bAnvil&r will allow you to split &6multiple Enchants&r on one book into seperate books
Using the &bObliteration&r enchant will allow you to split &6singular&r enchanted Books into seperate levels of Enchants
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.title: Ars Nouveau
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests0.de: The &bWorn Notebook&r is &eArs Nouveau&r's guidebook, teaching you everything in the mod.
There's one in the &6Akashic Tome&r that you spawned with.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests1.de: &6Spellbooks&r are the focus for your spells. They are &6where spells are customized and cast from&r.
The &bNovice Spell Book&r can support only Tier 1 Glyphs.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests2.de: To make a spell, hold your Spellbook and use the &6Open Book&r key (default is 'C').
First, you need to define the &6form&r: how the spell finds its &6target&r. For example, self, projectile, or touch.
Next, pick the &6effect&r: what the spell &6does&r. For example, harming or breaking.
Finally, you can optionally name the spell, then click &6Create&r. Now, you can cast the spell by right-clicking the Book!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests3.de: Upgrading into the more powerful &bMage's Spell Book&r allows access to &6Tier 2 Glyphs&r.
It will also &6permanently increase your Mana and Mana Regen&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests4.de: The &bArchmage Spell Book&r is the ultimate spell book, allowing access to &6Tier 3 Glyphs&r and upgrading your Mana further.
One of the ingredients requires &6defeating the Wilden&r, a summonable boss.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests5.de: &6Source&r is the magical power that drives all spell energy in the mod.
There are many ways to collect and use it, but it is always stored in &bSource Jars&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests6.de: &bSourcelinks&r &6generate Source&r in a variety of ways, depending on the specific Sourcelink.
The Agronomic Sourcelink is a good early option. It generates Source &6when crops grow nearby&r. It works better if the crop is Magebloom or Sourceberry.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests7.de: &bSourcestone&r is a nice decorative block, and is also used in several recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests8.de: The &bRitual Brazier&r is used to cast &6rituals&r, which perform a variety of functions. Some are semi-permanent, some are single-use.
Rituals are started by inserting a &bRitual Tablet&r. Some rituals allow you to optionally &6throw additional items in&r to change how it works. Right-click the Brazier to start it when ready.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests9.de: Now that you have &bSource&r gems and gold, you can combine a Source gem with 8 stones around it to create a Source stone. This magically imbued stone will act as a basis for many of the &eArs&r machinery. Use it to make an &bEnchantment Apparatus&r to refine material catalysts further.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests10.d: The &bDominion Wand&r is used to &6control Source Relays&r as well as &6automation-based summon creatures&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests11.d: &bMagebloom&r is a very magically powerful plant, which is created in the Enchanting Apparatus.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests12.d: Magebloom can be harvested and then crushed into &bMagebloom Fiber&r, which is used in several recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests13.d: The &bScribe's Table&r is one of the most important blocks within the mod. It is used to &6create Spell Glyphs&r, which allow you to make more spells.
Right-click the Table with a &6Spell Book&r to open its GUI, then &6click the Glyph you want to craft&r.
It'll tell you what ingredients are needed, then click &6Select&r when ready. &6Throw the ingredients&r on top of the Table, and the Glyph will be crafted.
You can also &6inscribe Spells&r to be used in the &6Spell Turret&r. See the &6Worn Notebook&r for details.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests14.d: Most of your &6basic spell components&r are &bTier 1&r.
Right-click a Glyph to learn it.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests15.d: More powerful &bGlyphs&r can only be cast by a &6Mage's Spell Book&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests16.d: &bTop tier&r spell components can only be cast through an &bArchmage Spell Book&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests17.d: &bAmethyst Golems&r can be summoned using a &6Ritual of Awakening&r while near &6Budding Amethyst&r.
Once summoned, use a &6Dominion Wand&r on them, then sneak right-click an inventory like a Chest or Barrel.
The Golem will then &6automatically farm nearby Amethyst&r, and even converts Amethyst Blocks into Budding Amethyst!
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests18.s: The wyrms go in, the wyrms go out...
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests18.d: The &bStorage Lectern&r can be used to &6view, manage, and access multiple nearby inventories&r, within a 30 block radius.
&bBookwyrms&r are required for the Lectern to function, as they are what actually connect the inventories to the Lectern. The more the Lectern has, the more inventories can be linked.
First, use a Dominion Rod on the inventory you wish to connect to, then use it again on the Lectern. This will connect the two, allowing the Lectern to access that inventory.
If you place an inventory adjacent to the Lectern, and &odo not bind it&r, it will act as an &6input&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests19.d: &bRunic Chalk&r allows you to draw symbols on the ground that &6cast a spell on whatever walks on it&r.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests20.d: &bSpell Turrets&r are &6automatic spell casters&r, enabling many a magical contraption.
Insert a Spell Parchment, and the Turret will cast the spell when given a Redstone signal.
Casting the spell &6costs Source&r from a nearby Source Jar.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests21.d: If you make a &6Nether Portal shape&r made of Sourcestone, supply Source, and throw a bound &bWarp Scroll through&r, and it will become a &6Warp Portal&r!
This will cause a &6permanent portal&r to the location bound by the Scroll.
The &bStabilized Warp Scroll&r is required to teleport across dimensions.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests22.s: Make a set of magical armor
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests22.d: &bMagical Armor&r &6increases the wearer's Mana and Mana Regen&r, and can &6be upgraded&r.
There are three tiers. The Sorcerer's set can be upgraded more, while the other two protect more.
They can be &6upgraded in the Enchanting Apparatus&r to increase their tier.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests23.d: &bArmor Threads&r are basically &6upgrades&r to your magical armor. They are applied on the &bAlteration Table&r.
First, place the armor, then the Threads, then remove the armor.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests24.d: &6Starbuncles&r naturally appear in wooded areas in search of golden nuggets.
While &6Starbuncles&r are normally afraid of humans, they will allow someone to approach if they are holding a gold nugget.
When a &6Starbuncle&r has picked up a golden nugget, it will vanish from this World and leave behind &5Starbuncle Shards&r.
To summon a &6Starbuncle&r, use a &bStarbuncle Charm&r on the ground.
Summoned &6Starbuncles&r will pickup nearby items and can move items between inventories such as chests.
&6Starbuncles&r will harvest fully grown Source Berry Bushes around it.
A &6Starbuncle&r will drop its charm when Dispelled or when killed.
P.s.: You may dye them any color.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests26.d: Using Scrolls on Chests that are bound to the Storage Lectern will make prioritizing and sorting items quite trivial.
Place a configured Scroll on an Itemframe attached to the Chest and the Bookwyrm will take that into consideration
(More info about each Scroll on the next page)
Chests with Scrolls are prioritized first, after that non configured Chests.
The order of binding is also taken in consideration here
When this scroll is attached to an inventory, entities will only insert items that already exist in the inventory.
To attach the scroll, place an item frame on the inventory, and place a Mimic Scroll in it.
Provides a list of items to automation related entities.
To inscribe an item, place on the Scribe's Table and use blocks and items on the table while sneaking.
When given to a Starbuncle, the Starbuncle will only pickup and take items on the scroll.
When attached to an inventory, Bookwyrms will only input items that are on the scroll.
Provides a list of items to automation related entities.
To inscribe an item, place on the Scribe's Table and use blocks and items on the table while sneaking.
When given to a Starbuncle, the Starbuncle will pickup and take any item that is NOT on this scroll.
When attached to an inventory, Bookwyrms will NOT place these items into the inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.ars_nouveau.quests27.d: Storage Lecterns can be linked together.
For this, make a second Storage Lectern and place it upto 30 blocks away from your \"main\" Storage lectern.
Now bind your second Storage Lectern to your main Storage lectern and you will have access to your main storage from the second Storage lectern.
The Storage Lectern can have Tabs.
Using an Anvil to rename Chests and binding those Chests to your Storage Lectern will show you different tabs on the left side of the GUI.
By default your Storage Lectern will show all inventories.
Now by selecting one of the named Tabs you can also specify the Bookwyrm to put items into a specific \"Tab\" chest.
Multiple Chest can use the same name, to group them up in the same Tab. Sorting Applies the same as explained before.
Bookwyrms can actually be dyed in a few diffrent colors!
(Tazz - \"My personal favorite color is the red one\")
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.title: Base Expansion
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests0: &bCompact Machines&r contain within them a &6small pocket dimension&r, which can be accessed through a &bPersonal Shrinking Device&r!
If the chunk the Compact Machine is in is loaded, the chunks inside the machine are loaded.
Higher tiers have more space inside. See each block's tooltip for exact sizes.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests1: &eBuilding Gadgets&r offers many tools for helping to build.
The basic &bBuilding Gadget&r is great for &6quickly building out structures&r.
The &bCopy-Paste Gadget&r can &6recreate structures&r, including ones from the internet!
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests2: &bConstruction Wands&r are used to &6place multiple blocks at once&r.
Use them on the side of a line of blocks, and it will place on all blocks on the line.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests3: We're going to look at different ways to customize the look of any base. First up, the &bChisel&r from &eRechiseled&r.
This is the first item that can expand your texture palette. Some choices have &6connected textures&r!
The &eChipped&r is a series of crafting tables that change the textures of several blocks and items.
The easiest to craft is the &bCarpenter's Table&r which, you guessed it, alters wood built items such as planks, logs, trap doors, torches, bookshelves, doors, etc.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests4: Don't Take This Quest Line For Granite
The &bMason Table&r will help you customize stone, clay, bricks, and netherrack based items.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests5: The &bBotanist Table&r will customize a variety of plants as well as the dirt, sand and gravel.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests6: The &bThe Glassblower&r allows you to customize all kinds of glass blocks. Very &ca&6e&es&at&3h&9e&5t&ci&6c&r.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests7: The &bTinkering Table&r and &bAlchemy Table&r will cover a variety of other blocks, such as Redstone, Amethyst, and the like.
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests9: &bCharms&r from &eApotheosis&r, when activated, &6provide a long-lasting potion effect&r.
They can even be &6enchanted&r to last longer!
ftbquests.chapter.base_expansion.quests1: Framed Blocks allows you to tailor your base designs around the aethetic of your choice even if block variants that you want dont exist by default. You can shape wedges, slopes, stairs and much more. Check out the guide for more information.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.title: Basic
ftbquests.chapter.basic.subtitle: From chests to vaults
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests0.subtitle: Bigger on the inside
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests0.descript: &eIron Chests&r adds several tiers of &bChests&r, each holding more than the last.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests1.title: Functional Drawers
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests1.subtitle: For the Fat Stacks
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests1.descript: &eFunctional Drawers&r adds a variety of &bDrawers&r, which hold a large amount of a single item per slot.
Unupgraded, a Drawer holds 32 stacks split equally between its slots.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests2.subtitle: The Big Splash
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests2.descript: &bFluid Drawers&r store a fluid in each slot.
They can be upgraded in the same way Drawers can.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests3.subtitle: &lDrawer&r
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests3.descript: &bCompacting Drawers&r allow you to input and output the &6Nugget, Ingot, and Block forms&r of whatever's inside.
Beware: this plays oddly with the &6Storage Bus&r, &6External Storage&r, and the like.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests4.subtitle: Mass storage
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests4.descript: The &bStorage Controller&r's inventory is composed of &6all the inventories of linked Drawers&r. This makes it ideal for automation etc.
Use a &bLinking Tool&r on the Storage Controller to set it, then click it on other Drawers in an &612 block radius&r to connect them. They do not have to be touching.
&6Controller Extensions&r can be used to pipe to into or out of a drawer systemfurther away from the controller.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests5.subtitle: Number go up
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests5.descript: &bStorage Upgrades&r can be installed onto Drawers to &6increase their capacity&r.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests6.descript: These &bFunctional Upgrades&r change how the Drawer works in some way, other than the amount it can store.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests7.descript: These &bConversion Upgrades&r can be used to &6upgrade a Chest's tier&r.
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests8.subtitle: Too much of a good thing
ftbquests.chapter.basic.quests8.descript: &bTrash Cans&r delete anything that enters them.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.title: Mana Manifest
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests0.title: Mana generating flower
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests0.descri: Mana is made using special &bMana-generating Flowers&r. The first and easiest is the &6Kekimaru&r, the cake eating flower.
Each makes Mana using a different method; see the &6Lexica Botania&r for details on each.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests1.title: Flower Power
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests1.descri: You can get &bFlowers&r by using Bone Meal on Grass. Using Bone Meal directly on a flower will &6duplicate it&r.
Once you've gotten a few, it would be a good idea to craft them into &6Floral Fertilizer&r.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests2.title: Sky of Beginnings
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests2.descri: Once you've gotten &bMystical Flowers&r, either from Floral Fertilizer or by chance, you can start working with Mana.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests3.descri: &bMana Spreaders&r move Mana, and &bMana Pools&r store it. A Spreader will use an adjacent Pool's Mana if it has none.
If a Spreader is &6bound to a block that can hold Mana&r (and the Spreader &ohas&r Mana), the Spreader will &6shoot a Mana Burst at it&r.
Generating flora will push mana to their bound Spreader.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests4.title: Wand of the Forest
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests4.descri: The &bWand of the Forest&r is essentially Botania's wrench. Its main use is to &6bind blocks to other blocks&r.
While in Bind Mode (swap by sneak right-clicking), sneak right-click a block, then sneak right-click the block you want to bind it to.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests5.descri: The &bAlchemy Catalyst&r is placed under the Mana Pool, and &6adds some recipes for throwing items in&r.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests6.descri: The &bRunic Altar&r is used to craft items together using Mana.
Throw the ingredients on, and give it Mana from a Spreader to start.
Once it's done, &6throw Livingstone on top&r and use a Wand of the Forest on it.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests7.descri: The &bTerrestrial Agglomeration Plate&r is used to craft &6Terrasteel&r. It is part of a multiblock; see the &6Lexica Botania&r for construction details.
Rather than being powered by a Mana Spreader, you must use &6Sparks&r.
Attach a Spark to the Plate, and another to a nearby Mana Pool. When needed, the Plate will pull Mana through the Spark.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests8.title: The Portal to Alfheim
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests8.descri: The &bPortal to Alfheim&r is a multiblock structure, powered by Mana, that allows you to &6trade an item for another&r by throwing it through.
See the &6Lexica Botania&r for construction details.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests9.title: The Ritual of Gaia
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests9.descri: The &bRitual of Gaia&r allows you to &6summon and fight the Gaia Guardian&r, a powerful boss.
To do so, build the stage (see the book) and use a &bTerrasteel Ingot&r on the Beacon at the center.
ftbquests.chapter.botania.quests10.title: Integrated Magic
ftbquests.chapter.create.title: Create
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests0.descrip: The &bMillstone&r is one of the first methods to automatically crush items.
It can automate all &6Hammer&r recipes, as well as many others.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests1.descrip: &bMechanical Crafters&r can autocraft recipes, including some that are larger than 3x3.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests2.title: Motors
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests2.descrip: &bElectric Motors&r uses FE to generate rotational energy. The conversion rate is roughly 1:1 with a slight loss to FE. This can be a convenient solution for setting up SU energy in remote locations by first converting to FE
and then back to SU where needed.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests3.descrip: &bDeployers&r will &6use the item given&r on the block in front of it.
It can either left or right-click, and target blocks, items, or entities.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests4.descrip: &bMechanical Arms&r can move items with much more precision than Mechanical Belts.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests5.descrip: Either when used alone, or when part of a contraption, the &bMechanical Saw&r will &6cut down trees in front of it&r.
An upward facing Saw can be used to &6process certain items&r.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests6.descrip: When used as part of a contraption, the &bMechanical Harvester&r will harvest and replant crops it passes through.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests7.descrip: The &bSpout&r will &6fill items below it with fluid&r, if they are in a Depot or Belt.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests8.descrip: Some mixing recipes need to be &6heated&r. This is done using a &bBlaze Burner&r.
The Blaze Burner &6accepts furnace fuel&r to become heated.
To become &6over-heated&r, you will have to feed it &6Blaze Cakes&r!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests9.descrip: The &bChute&r works much like a Hopper, but will drop item entities instead.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests10.descri: The &bSmart Chute&r functions the same, but can be &6filtered&r.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests11.descri: &bBrass&r is a flexible alloy, and is the basis for many of &eCreate&r's more advanced machines.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests12.descri: Inventories on contraptions cannot be accessed manually. Instead, you have to use a pair of &bPortable Storage Interfaces&r!
Place one on the contraption, and another that is not. Whenever the two line up (aka, when the contraption moves close), the contraption will pause to allow items to pass through.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests13.descri: The &bBrass Funnel&r works like the Andesite version, but &6can be filtered&r!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests14.descri: The &bMechanical Bearing&r is the foundation of most Create &6contraptions&r, which are basically freeform moving multiblocks.
When rotational force is applied, it will &6rotate the connected contraption&r. This enables certain blocks, like &6Harvesters&r, &6Cutters&r, and &6Deployers&r to work!
You can attach more blocks using &6Glue&r, and use &6Chassis&r to make the contraption larger. Make sure to &6check the Ponders&r!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests15.descri: The &bRolling Mill&r is your earliest way of creating &6Metal Rods&r, &6Metal Wires&r and &6Quartz Fiber&r.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests16.descri: While being able to craft a &bBasic Energizer&r before, there was little to no use for it.
With the acquirement of &6Compressed Iron&r, process it further into &bOvercharged Iron&r.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests17.title: Create, Power, Su and You!
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests17.descri: In &dFTB Skies Expert&r most Methods of producing Stress Units have been disabled.
Here is some information about the possible Machines that produce Stress Units for you
Starting off with the Handcrank, you quickly want to move towards

[\"\",\"\",{\"text\":\"[ Rickety Waterwheels ]\",\"color\":\"gold\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\",\"value\":\"/ftbquests open_book 703631B507075DC1\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Take me to the Quest\"]}}]
Shortly after, you want to focus on a more permanent Solution. You next step up will be the

[\"\",\"\",{\"text\":\"[ Diesel Generator ]\",\"color\":\"gold\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\",\"value\":\"/ftbquests open_book 2BBB711EC45D27B3\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Take me to the Quest\"]}}]
These will have multiple Tiers and can accept multiple tiers of Fuel. Combination of the best possible available is Key to get the most Stress Units.
ftbquests.chapter.create.quests17.tasks0: I have read this! (or not, i'm just a checkmark)
ftbquests.chapter.digital.title: Digital
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests0.descri: &eApplied Energistics 2&r will need &bCertus Quartz&r and lots of &bPrinted Silicon Circuits&r to start.

Unfortunately, it's not simple. Certus isn't too bad, just &6sift Dust through a Mana Mesh&r, but the printed circuits will take you on a journey through several processing steps to arrive at the final product as outlined in chapter 3.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests1.descri: &6Certus Quartz Dust&r can be converted to &bCertus Quartz Crystal&r in a &eCrystallizer&r or later on, in &eMekanism&r's &6Enriching Chamber&r.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests2.descri: It might be a good idea to craft &bCharged Certus Quartz&r into some &6Budding Certus Quartz&r, to get a renewable source!
You'll need to first energize them however, which will require a Powah Energizing orb.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests3.descri: &bFluix Crystals&r can be created expensively in the dissolution chamber at first, and later more efficiently once you've unlocked the Quantum Assembler.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests4.descri: &bME Cables&r connect all the devices on your &eAE2&r network.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests5.title: Applied Energistics 2
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests5.descri: While you can technically have a small network using only an &bEnergy Accepter&r, an &bME Controller&r is definitely recommended.
We've included a &6Ponder&r to show how they work!
To craft this you'll need to miniaturize a small construct, the blueprint can be found in your schematic table
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests6.descri: The &bModular Storage&r block is used to store items. Depending on the &bStorage Module&r installed, it can hold up to 300 stacks.

Install a Storage Module by inserting it into the &6top left slot on the bottom left&r, then click the L button to lock it. If removed, &6the items will stay in the Storage Module&r item, not the block.
Above the crafting grid, you can &6store up to 6 recipes&r. Double-clicking a stored recipe will fill the grid instantly.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests7.descri: While you access items at the &6Modular Storage&r, the items are actually stored in &bStorage Modules&r.
The Tier 1 Storage Module can hold 100 stacks.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests8.descri: The Tier 2 Storage Module can hold 200 stacks.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests9.descri: The Tier 3 Storage Module can hold 300 stacks.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests10.descr: The Tier 4 Storage Module can hold 500 stacks.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests11.descr: Mekanism Quantum Item Orchestration is a powerful mass storage solution that is available to you as soon as you are able to make basic circuits. The drive array is more expensive and you won't be able to make more until later but you're given one here as a quest reward. Each drive array can hold up to 12 storage drives.
This system can tie into most other storage system logistics as well such as AE2, Functional Storage and Integrated Dynamics.
ftbquests.chapter.digital.quests19.descr: Using the &bCrystallizer&r, various Dusts can be processed back into their original form.
Be sure to check JEI for the possibilities.
ftbquests.chapter.elemental_craft.title: Elemental Craft
ftbquests.chapter.elemental_craft.quests: Inert Elemental Source
The path of the elements
These &bInert Crystals&r are normally found in ores buried deep below the surface, but there isn't exactly a surface here them to be buried under.
Instead, get them by transmuting &6Source Gem Blocks&r with a Pure Daisy.
Not-so-inert Crystals
By making the &bContained Crystal&r, you can enhance its conductivity and make it more receptive to elemental energies.
Element Evaporator
Make an Element Evaporator
Elemental energy needs to be captured to be used.
Place an &bElement Evaporator&r directly on an &bElement Container&r and then insert Elemental Shards.
The Evaporator will begin collecting and storing the energy in the Container.

[\"\",\"Be sure to also check out the \\n\",{\"text\":\"[ Elementalcraft ]\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\",\"value\":\"/ftbquests open_book 23EED105DF68860B\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Take me to the Chapter\"]}},\" Chapter\"]
Drenched Metal, not Rust!
Infusing Iron with elemental water will produce &bDrenched Iron&r, which is more malleable and receptive to elemental tinkering.
Make an Element Container
The full-sized &bElement Container&r can store &6100,000&r of an element, compared to the Small Container's 1000.
Otherwise, it works the same.
Make an Element Binder
The &bElemental Binder&r uses much more elemental energy, and &6must be placed on a full-sized Container&r.
The Binder is used to &6craft multiple items together&r, along with elemental energy.
&6Place the ingredients in order&r, starting at the top and going clockwise. It'll use up elemental energy and then complete the craft once it's used enough.
Swift as a coursing river...
&bSwift Alloy&r is a higher-end resource for crafting.
By our powers combined
The &bPure Infuser&r is used to craft some of the more advanced recipes in the mod. It is used to &6craft all 4 elements together&r with items.
Place each of the four &bPedestals&r around it, with one block between. Provide each Pedestal its element using Element Pipes.
Place the item ingredients on the correct Pedestals according to the recipe, and it will be crafted.
My Springaline, My Springaline
&bSpringaline&r can be crafted one at a time in the &6Infuser&r.
You can also craft it into a &6Springaline Cluster&r and then mine it with Fortune to multiply it.
Now we're cooking with gas!
The &bFire Furnace&r utilizes the fire element to &6smelt items&r at an accelerated rate.
Fire Furnace
The &bGem Crystallizer&r will use a &6Pure Crystal&r to infuse an element into a Diamond, creating an &6Elemental Gem&r.
At least it's not research!
The &bSpell Desk&r is used to create &6Spells&r, which perform a variety of functions.
FIREBALL!!!!!!!
Each &bSpell Scroll&r says what it needs in its tooltip.
See the &6Elementopedia&r for details on each spell&r.
Spell Scrolls
Pure Protection
&bPure Rock&r is incredibly resiliant, and is &6Wither-proof&r.
Endless book of spells
The &bGrimoire&r can hold &6up to 100 Spell Scrolls&r! You cannot cast from it, however.
Redistributed Elemental Wealth
&bShrines&r use a specific element to &6change the world around them&r in some way.
For example, they might &6make Lava&r, &6disable teleports&r, &6spawn mobs&r, etc, depending on the Shrine.
Shrines do not need an Element Container, they instead accept element directly via Element Pipes.
Shrines
Make an Element Pipe
&bElement Pipes&r move elements between Containers.
Click on a Pipe connection to toggle it, or to make it pull from the Container it's on.
Element Pipes
Battlemage
&bSpell foci&r can &6hold multiple spells&r.
Add a Spell to a focus by &6combining them in an Anvil&r. Cycle through by scrolling while sneaking.
Spell Foci
REMEMBER ME
&bShrine Upgrades&r increase the power of the Shrine they are placed on, in some way.
Many only work on a specific Shrine; see the &6Elementopedia&r for a list of each.
Shrine Upgrades
Instrument Upgrades
&bRunes&r are basically &6upgrades&r for instruments.
Place the &bRune Inscriber&r on an Element Container, insert the ingredients, and then use and &ohold&r a &bRune Inscription Chisel&r to craft the Rune.
Runes
Fireite is a magically infused netherite that has been purified to enhance its alchemical fire properties. You'll use this in several of the highly advanced metallurgical processes.
ftbquests.chapter.everything_from_nothin: With a renewable source of Cobble, it's time to start thinking about &6automating and scaling&r.
&bAuto-hammers&r will automatically hammer the item inside. It will &6pull items from an inventory on the blue side&r, and push the output into an inventory on the red side.
By distributing your Cobble to multiple &6lines of Auto-hammers&r, you can completely automate each of the siftable blocks!
&6Manasteel Mesh&r upgrades into a &bSpringaline Infused Desh Mesh&r using Springaline Desh Alloy.
The &bManasteel Mesh&r has the ability to extract &6even rarer materials&r that the Andesite Mesh cannot.

[\"\",{\"text\":\"Click here\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"4FA6ADCA7857A92F\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Botania chapter\"]}},\" to see the Botania quest chapter for help in making Mana Steel.\"]

Obtained by crushing &bEndstone&r. There are several ways to get &bEndstone&r. You can &6summon a possessed Endermite&r with &6Occultism&r and then convert that to &bendstone&r brick for a &6material generator&r. Alternatively, once you have &6Budding Amethyst&r, one will occasionally spawn from the Amethyst. You could also &6build a portal to the End&r or &6fly to the Sky's End in a rocket&r.
You can get &bNetherrack&r using &ePedestal&r's Material Generator on Nether Bricks.
You get &oNether Bricks&r by throwing Bricks into the Spiritfire.
Using an &6Andesite Mesh&r to sift &6Crushed Netherrack&r has a chance of dropping &bthese materials&r.
Crushed End Stone → Springaline Desh Mesh
Using a &6Springaline Desh Mesh&r will allow &6Crushed End Stone&r to drop &bDimensional Shards&r.
Sifters that are &6waterlogged&r sometimes produce alternative resources.
Using a &6Manasteel Mesh&r will get everything an Andesite Mesh can.
It will also drop &bPrismarine Shards and Crystals&r.
Using an &6Andesite Mesh&r to sift &6waterlogged Sand&r has a chance of dropping &bthese materials&r.
Using a &6Springaline Desh Mesh&r will allow &6Crushed Netherrack&r to drop &bNetherite Scrap&r.
&6Waterlogged Sand&r does &cnot have any additional drops&r when using higher tier meshes.
Using an &6Andesite Mesh&r to sift &6Soul Sand&r has a chance of dropping &bthese materials&r.
&6Soulsand&r does &cnot have any additional drops&r when using a Manasteel Mesh.
Using an &6Springaline Desh Mesh&r will allow &6Soul Sand&r to drop &bGhast Tears&r.
ftbquests.chapter.food.title: Foodies + Farmers
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests0.title: Chop Chop
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests0.subtitle: Knives Out!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests0.descripti: The &bCutting Board&r and &bKnife&r are the basic tools for preparing more advanced food items.
Slice down plants and meats into more delicate cuts to make better foods.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests1.subtitle: Shears for food and fun
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests1.descripti: &bShears&r are useful for harvesting Grass and Leaves, which can be put to use in the Composter or the Sifter.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests2.title: E I E I O
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests2.subtitle: Animal farm
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests2.descripti: There doesn't seem to be any animals nearby, nor anywhere for them to spawn. You should probably &6give them somewhere to&r.
Animals can spawn on &6grass that can see daylight&r, if it's &6at least 24 blocks away&r. Where do they come from? Who knows!

[\"\",\"There's also an \",{\"text\":\"event\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"4E44C546CAEDD703\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Events quest\"]}},\" that can randomly force a mob to spawn on nearby well-lit grass.\"]
Finally, you can use the &eSpirits&r mod to force specific mobs to spawn.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests3.title: Busy Busy Bees
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests3.subtitle: Buzzin and Beeing
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests3.descripti: You can fairly easily craft a rudimentary &bBeehive&r, which is alright for housing whatever Bees you can attract.
It's a good idea to upgrade it into an &6Advanced Beehive&r, which can be harvested without angering its tenants.
You can &6lure and breed Bees&r from events using Poppies!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests4.title: Rice is Nice!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests4.subtitle: But where are the seeds?
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests4.descripti: &bRice&r is grown by &6using Rice on Dirt with one Water source on top&r.
Once the rice is fully grown, right-click it with a &6Knife&r to harvest!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests5.descripti: The basic &bBurger Patty&r is a good starting point for using the Cutting Board. Eat as wide a variety as possible to get more hearts!
The &6Lunchbox&r allows you to &6carry a variety of food&r. You can eat directly from it, rather than cluttering your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests6.subtitle: Favorable Floof
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests6.descripti: You can shear Sheep for &bWool&r, which is useful for several recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests7.subtitle: This little piggie...
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests7.descripti: The &bMarket&r will allow you to &6buy most seeds&r.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests8.subtitle: Don't waste diamonds on...
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests8.descripti: Working the land by hoeing Dirt near Water will create Farmland for crops.
You can use Bone Meal (or equivalents) to speed the process up. It may be worth looking in to automating farms as well.
For more information, see the Create, Industrial Foregoing, and Thermal Expansion chapters.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests9.title: Wheat and other crops
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests9.subtitle: Let it grow, let it Growwww
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests9.descripti: &bWheat&r is one of the most versatile crops. From Bread to Cakes, it's a staple.
Expand your farm from here with a variety of different crops.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests10.subtitle: Make a Stove
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests10.descript: The &bStove&r is an improved &6Campfire&r, as it can cook &66 foods&r at once instead of 4.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests11.subtitle: Make a Cooking Pot
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests11.descript: The &bCooking Pot&r is a unique cooking appliance that allows you to &6make several new recipes&r, like Soups, Stews, and Roasts!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests12.title: Master Chef
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests12.subtitle: Not to be confused with Master Chief
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests12.descript: A &6diverse diet&r will &bgrant you bonus hearts&r! Use the &6Food Book&r to keep track of what foods you've eaten, and how many you have left until your next heart.
In addition, some of the higher tier foods will &6grant you buffs&r when eaten!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests13.title: Makin Bacon
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests13.subtitle: And I'll put it in a pancake
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests13.descript: Cutting down Pork Chops will make &bBacon&r, which many consider the best cut of meat. Others may not, but they're wrong.
Note: You can also obtain Bacon by using &6Force Shears&r on a pig, but do so at your own risk.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests14.subtitle: Chicken Nuggies
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests14.descript: Raw Chicken can be sliced into &bChicken Cuts&r, and the Eggs can be collected and used for even more options.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests15.subtitle: That's what Sashimi Said
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests15.descript: Raw Fish can be sliced down to more useful cuts to make a nice alternative source of meat.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests16.subtitle: A Mutton for Punishment
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests16.descript: Sheep provide a nice source of &bMutton&r as well as Wool.
It can be broken down further on the Cutting Board to make some gourmet meals!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests17.title: The Heart of the Kitchen
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests17.subtitle: Where the magic happens
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests17.descript: The &bCooking Table&r will allow you to &6quickly craft foods&r that you have the ingredients for.
The &bHay Nest&r provides a place where nearby chickens will deposit their eggs. You can pipe from it to allow your chickens to enjoy  free range life instead of that 1x1 hopper coop.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests18.title: ... or Swim.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests18.subtitle: Enough water for fusion?!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests18.descript: The &bSink&r will &6provide Water to the Cooking Table&r.
You can also &6extract water with pipes&r at an extreme rate.
...well, in non-expert packs at least. No magical infinite capacity plumbing here, sorry.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests19.subtitle: Ice is Nice!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests19.descript: The &bFridge&r is another storage location, but has two &6very useful upgrades&r. Their functions are in their tooltip.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests20.title: Got Milk?
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests20.subtitle: Udderly Delicious
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests20.descript: You can squish a &bCow&r into a &6Milk Jar&r using an anvil and gravity. Now your kitchen can produce all the milk you'll need.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests21.title: You Blockhead!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests21.subtitle: I should have known.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests21.descript: &bKitchen Counters and Cabinets&r provide the Cooking Table with &6extra storage&r, so you don't have to hold everything in your inventory.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests22.title: Lets get baked!
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests22.subtitle: No soggy bottoms here
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests22.descript: An &bOven&r will allow you to &6quickly cook foods&r, and works from the Cooking Table!
If you add a &6Heating Unit&r, you can power the Oven with FE instead of furnace fuel.
&oInstall Upgrades by right-clicking them on their block.
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests23.title: For in this sleep...
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests23.subtitle: What dreams may come
ftbquests.chapter.food.quests23.descript: &bBeds&r will allow you to set your spawn, in addition to passing the night into day.
The &6Rain Shield&r provided by the quest reward will &6completely disable rain&r around it, for those who hate a nice rainy afternoon.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.title: II - Getting on Up
Now that you've got power, some magic and basic automations this chapter will guide you towards primarily progressing towards launching a rocket into space as well as enhancing your automation options.
Using the Elemental Infuser will allow you to craft Drenched Steel Ingot. These can be further processed with the Enchanting Apparatus into &bMagically-Inclined Steel&r.
With all the resources gathered, crafting a &bFluid Extractor&r shouldn't be too much of an issue.
Place it down, next to some &6Wooden Logs&r and gather Latex
It can be used as any Stone, but also serves as crafting component for the Pressure Chamber.
Make sure to visit the &dAir Bending and You&r Chapter for more pneumaticcraft specific quests.
Once you have collected enough Latex, be sure to grab some
&bPhenolic Resin&r was effectively the first Plastic to be sold commercially.
Here we use it to make &6Duroplast Sheets&r
Making these plastic sheets by encapsulating some &6Paper&r with &6Phenolic Resin&r will reward you a sturdy base for making Circuits soon
The Pressure Chamber is a Multiblock that can be
and needs at least 1 Pressure Valve and 1 (preferably 2) Chamber Interfaces.

TIP: Bigger is not always better, at least a first. It can take quite a while to fully charge a large pressure chamber. It may be more advantageous to start with a smaller 3x3 until you can produce pressure fast enough.
Through the Pressure Valve, Compressed Air can be inserted into the Chamber.
Depending on the recipe requirements, you might need more or less pressure.
Be sure to check out JEI for the recipes.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests10: Previously &bEthanol&r was made in the &6Create Basin&r.
With this new Technology, creating &bEthanol&r is much more efficient.
Simply make some &bYeast Culture&r with some Mushrooms and Water.
Then process it further with some plant-based resource.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests11: Using the &6Magma Crucible&r will allow you to smelt some &6Silver Ingots&r
The &bMolten Silver&r is needed to create &6Acetaldehyde&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests12: The Machine Frames can be upgraded even more.
With Duraplast Sheets and Latex, crafting Simple Machine Frames is your next step.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests13: Toss some &6Magically-Inclined Steel&r into your Manapool and get Manasteel.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests14: A &bThermopneumatic Processing Plant&r is used to process liquids into other liquids.
LPG and Coal together in this machine can produce &6Liquid Plastic&r.
It can also be used in fuel cracking.
Heavy fuels can be cracked into lighter ones. This means &6Diesel&r can be turned into &6Kerosene&r,which can turn into Gasoline and then further into LPG.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests15: &bVolatile Redstone&r is one of the new Liquids made in the &6Processing Plant&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests16: &6Volatile Redstone&r needs to be stilled into Redstone Acid and Destabilized Redstone for further processing.
Seems that the &bFractionating Still&r is the perfect candidate for this task
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests17: One of the Products gained is the &b{item.immersiveengineering.redstone_acid_bucket}&r
Use it with some Mob Drops to create an &6{item.pneumaticcraft.etching_acid_bucket}&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests19: Circuits are a complicated manner. To create a &bCircuit Backplane&r we first need to work the &6Duroplast Sheet&r with some &6Copper Sheets&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests20: Crafting with the &6Workbench&r in Bulk is great
The &bAutomated Engineer's Workbench&r makes automating these recipes a breeze.
Don't forget the schematic cannon to make building this easier!
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests21: To get started in Botania, you need to generate Mana.
The first way to obtain Mana, will be by creating a &bKekimurus&r and feeding it Cake.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests22: Crafting Cake requires you to setup a proper &5Create&r Assembly line, where you will process various Materials into Batter and Icing to finally make some Cakes.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests23: Elements can be infused into Materials with the &bElement Infuser&r.
Place the Element Infuser on top of an Element Container filled with one of the 4 Elements and place your Materials on the Infuser.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests24: To get the Logic in &bLogic Circuits&r, it needs to get some &6Electronic Components&r and wired up with more &6Copper&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests25: &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r can easily be created by using the {block.thermal.machine_bottler}
Pouring &6Destabilized Redstone&r over a &6{item.immersiveengineering.logic_circuit}&r will result in these prerequisite for some PCBs
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests26: The &b{item.pneumaticcraft.etching_acid_bucket}&r is one of the last steps of creating &6{item.pneumaticcraft.printed_circuit_board}
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests27: Fill this with &6Etching&r Acid and insert &bEmpty PCB&r's which have been exposed in a &6UV Light Box&r.
50C° for progressively faster etching (but Etching Acid will be slowly used when heated)
If you want to automate this you can extract Unassembled PCB's from the sides, and Failed PCB's
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests28: &6{block.pneumaticcraft.uv_light_box}&r is needed to get the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r ready for the Etching Tank.
The longer the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r are in the &6{block.pneumaticcraft.uv_light_box}&r, the higher chance of success.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests29: Once the bar is full on the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r it means its Etching Success is at 100% and it ready to be tossed into the &6{block.pneumaticcraft.etching_tank}&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests30: If your &6{item.pneumaticcraft.empty_pcb}&r has been exposed to UV long enough, there is a good chance they will become &b{item.pneumaticcraft.unassembled_pcb}&r's when you etch them.
If they do fail however, you can use the &6{item.pneumaticcraft.failed_pcb}&r and blast off your mistakes to restart again
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests31: By slapping some &3{item.pneumaticcraft.transistor}s&r and &3{item.pneumaticcraft.capacitor}s&r on the &6{item.pneumaticcraft.unassembled_pcb}&r will finally yield the &b{item.pneumaticcraft.printed_circuit_board}&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests32: &bMana Diamonds&r are Diamonds infused with Mana. Throw said Diamonds into a Manapool and get some &bMana Diamonds
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests33: This &bAssembly Line&r will allow you to make more complicated space parts.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests34: Your Andesite Meshes deserve an upgrade.
Using the Manasteel will allow you to make &bManasteel Meshes&r which will unlock a plethora of new resources.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests35: One step closer to space! The &bNASA Workbench&r will help you assemble your first rocket.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests36: You're ready to take to the stars! A &bTier 1 Rocket&r will get you to the moon, and to orbital space.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests37: &bMagebloom&r seed will make it able to start growing Mageblooms, which will yield you some Magebloom Fiber when fully grown.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests38: &bMagebloom Fiber&r is a Magical Fiber which can be used to create Ars Nouveau Armor, which will give you some decent Armor and some Mana Benefits.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests39: To obtain &6Blaze Fiber&r, one must imbue some &bMagebloom Fiber&r with &bBlaze Powder&r and &bRaw Fire Shards&r.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests40: The next step of upgrading the Fiber, the &6Mana Infused String&r.
Simply tossing some Blaze Fiber into a Manapool will make it soak up the Mana and convert into this magical String.
This String can then be crafting into &bManaweave Cloth&r.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests41: Manaweave Cloth can be processed further. To make it sturdier, process it with Latex to make some &bMarine Fabric&r.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests42: Marine Fabric is just a stepping stone for &bProtective Fabric&r.
Processing it with some Polyethelyne will make it one step closer to the &6Space Suit&r.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests43: One more Mix and we get Polyethelyne.
Just combine the previously obtained Ethelyne with some Latex!
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests44: Using a Fluid Extractor and some logs will extract Latex.
Latex is an important crafting component, which is used in various recipes in FTB Skies.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests45: Processing Ethanol with Sulfur Dust will give you Ethelyne in a Processing Plant.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests46: Sifting Dust with the &6Manasteel Mesh&r will yield Sulfur, an intermediate resource needed for Ethelyne.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests47: Before you take to the stars, you'll need material capable of withstanding the dangers of space. The first step will be &bSpace Material&r. Combine aluminum, copper and steel in a pressure chamber to make it.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests48: Once you've made &bSpace Plating&r you'll be ready to make a space suit and other more complicated issues.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests49: You're almost ready to head to the stars. To craft the &bSpace Suit&r, you'll need a bunch of protective fabric, quite a bit of space plating, and a few other odds and ends. Like, for instance, Oxygen.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests51: It's time to launch your rocket.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests52: With the newly acquired Mana Diamonds, craft up some &bField Projectors&r.
These need to be placed a certain distance of each other to Shrinkify multiblocks into machines and other blocks and items.

[\"\",\"I would highly recommend you to look at the \",{\"text\":\"[ Field Projector Ponder ] \",\"color\":\"gold\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"run_command\",\"value\":\"/create ponder compactcrafting:field_projector\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Show me the Ponder\"]}},\" on how to set this puppy up!\"]
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests53: Filling the Element Container with Elemental Energy and using the Inscription Tool will allow you to attune Runes into a variety of Runes.
Each Rune has different stats and can be used to upgrade your Elementalcraft Machines.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests54: Upgrading Elementalcraft Machines is possible with Runes.
To get some Runes, craft a Rune Inscriber and Rune Inscription Chisel.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests55: With your new Source Condenser, grabbing a bucket of Source shouldn't be much of an issue.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests56: Source is Magic. Being able to bucket it and store it as a Fluid would be optimal.
Using the Source Condenser is exactly for that. It will even output into Tanks below.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests57: Combining &bBiodiesel&r and &bLiquified Source&r inside a Pneumaticcraft Fluid Mixer will allow you to create some &6Fuel&r.
&6Fuel&r will be needed if we want to go to space!
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests58: The &bOxygen Loader&r fills tanks of oxygen so you can breathe in space.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests59: &6Cinnabar&r together with &6Menril Resin&r inside the Processing Plant will get you some &bQuicksilver&r.
While &bQuicksilver&r is an excellent Fuelsource for Blaze Burners, its main usage is to create &bRaw Silver&r with &6Mana Powder&r.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests60: Sifting Dust with the &6Manasteel Mesh&r will yield &bCinnabar&r, an intermediate resource needed for Quicksilver.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests61: With that Latex Bucket, craft up a &bLatex Processing Unit&r and pipe in Water and Latex to get some &6Tiny Dry Rubber&r
Combined in a 3x3 Craft will give you Dry Rubber, which can further be processed into &6Rubber Sheets&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests62: &bLDPE&r or Low Density Polyethylene Sheets are a low grade industrial plastic
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests63: The &bDissolution Chamber&r takes FE, a liquid and several items and makes them into something new.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests64: The &bLiquid Crystallizer&r is the next step in the process. With it you can turn Liquid Force into Force Gems.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests65: Feed Liquid Force, stress and mana into the Liquid Crystalizer to make &bForce Crystals&r. You can now use these with the Bees or you can proceed to the next stage of making Force-Infused biodiesel.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests66: A &bPyrolyzer&r works like a coke oven, but uses electricity to convert logs into coal, and other carbon products. Much faster than a coke oven.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests67: Infuse magic into a tree to make &bForce Saplings&r
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests68: &bForce-Infused Biodiesel&r burns twice as long and produces twice as much stress units as traditional biodiesel.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_on_up.quests69: The &bInduction Smelter&r uses energy to fuse multiple types of materials together into more advanced alloys.
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.title: I - Getting Started
ftbquests.chapter.getting_started.quests: Log(Tree)
Growing on you
&bGrow the Sapling&r you spawned with, and chop it down.
Leaves can be run through a &6Sifter&r to give a higher chance per block of obtaining saplings.
They also make a great source of Compost or Apples with better meshes. It's worth investing in some &6Flint Shears&r when possible.
Logs
Sifter go Brrr
Sifting for treasures
&bSifters&r will allow you to run materials such as Gravel, Sand, and Dust through &6Meshes&r to find materials.
A &bHand Crank&r produces enough &6stress capacity&r for 8 Sifters! Sifters also have a Cog in them, so you can place them in a line.

Make sure the cogwheel that is part of the sifter aligns with the cogwheel your handcrank is on. You'll also need to make sure you've placed the mesh in the sifter. The material to sift should be thrown or hoppered into the top, not placed as a block.

You'll want to &lprioritize getting food&r as the hand crank can consume quite a bit of hunger! We've given you some but you should setup an auto fisher and work towards a wheat farm once you get some &bPasture Seeds&r to make grass.
Once you get wheat you can create &bChickenpalooza Gates&r for lots of chicken. Lastly, there should be an easter egg hidden somewhere on your island as well which may provide some assistance...
Cobbled together
These rock

&6Sneak right-click Grass, Dirt or Compact Machine Walls&r to collect &bRocks&r. These can be crafted into Cobblestone. You'll also find &bSoil&r which can be combined to make dirt in the same way. Combine both of them for &bGravel&r.
Holding soil or cobble clumps in your offhand will let you target what you're digging to be more selective.
Once you make your first sifter look towards automating cobble and dirt with a cobble generator from the &eCobble for Days&r mod.
This is Not a Drill
Hammer Time!
&bHammers&r can crush blocks into finer blocks.
See the Hammer's uses in JEI (using the U key) to see what blocks smash into what.
While holding the Hammer and looking at a smashable block, it will show you what it smashes into.
There are also automatic versions you can craft once you have the materials.
Hammers
Stringing you along
Flax on, flax off
&bString&r can be either &6harvested from Flax&r, or found on your island. Bone meal will allow the flax to grow much faster.
Stringing you along
The &bString Mesh&r isn't very sturdy or finely woven. It'll get &6the most basic resources&r, but not much else.
Gravel Alloys
Nuggets of wisdom here
Sifting Gravel will net you &bIron Shards&r. These can be crafted into &6Andesite Alloy&r, which is necessary for progression.
Rolling on the River
Water you doing step wheel
The Hand Crank quickly consumes hunger, and it's not very engaging either! Let's move on to something more efficient.
&bRickety Water Wheels&r produce rotational force from flowing water. Eventually you'll be able to make better sources, but that's later.
TIP: These waterwheels break over time. You can see the durability with engineer's goggles and they can be repaired by right clicking them with andesite alloys.
You can still create the tradition water wheels and windmills that don't break but they produce VERY minimal SU, mostly for running a small farm or decorative uses.
Material Generator
Material 'N You
With access to Lava, you can now craft and install a &bMaterial Generator&r onto a &bPedestal&r.

[\"\",\"For further documentation on Pedestals, \",{\"text\":\"[ Click here ]\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"23D7D83EBA8C36CE\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Take me to the Chapter\"]}},\" to see its quests.\"]
The most immediate use will be placing a stone block under the material generator to provide an unlimited source of cobble for you to sift for resources.
Hint: Make sure you have the upgrade in your OFF hand before right-clicking to insert it into the pedestal. Otherwise, you will only put the upgrade on display.
Dragon Glass
Obsidian Dreams
Now that you have a source of Lava, you can pour Water over it to get &bObsidian&r!
At this point you should be able to craft soul steel for a pickaxe that is capable of mining it.

[\"Once you've gotten into \", {\"text\":\"Botania\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"4FA6ADCA7857A92F\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Botania Chapter\"]}},\" you can also use your excess blaze powder to make obsidian by crafting it into blaze blocks and then transforming them with the pure daisy.\"]
Dust to Dust
That's just fine!
&bGravel&r, &bSand&r, and &bDust&r are the three primary blocks you can sift for materials.
Twisting turning through the nether
Going deeper...
&bThe Nether&r in &dFTB Skies&r is a void as well. Of course, some mobs can only spawn there, so it's &6worth building a mob farm&r there to obtain rare resources.
Once you have flight, you'll be able to explore for &6floating Nether Villages&r.
Power dust!
Redstone is your gateway into energy production and management. After you get some, look into some of the power generation mods like cyclic, thermal expansion and mekanism.
Dirt
Toil Soil

For now you can combine soil into dirt but eventually, you'll need a better method. Placing &bCompost&r or &bRich Soil&r under a &6Material Generator&r slowly yields an infinite supply of Dirt, useful for sifting or growing.
Dirt-making blocks
Oh Beehave!
No come back!
You may occasionally run into a &bLoot Bee&r that spawns around your island. They'll &6give you gifts&r if you stay nearby!
However, they may fly off and bee lost forever. You can use a &6Lead&r to keep them in place, but they'll also follow you if you hold a &6Poppy&r.
Once they've shed their beeautiful delights you can keep them around for breeding bees and making honey!
Follow the nether brick road
You can get &bNether Bricks&r by &6tossing Bricks into &eOccultism&r's Spiritfire&r. That can be placed under the Material Generator for a &6limitless source of Netherrack&r!

[\"\",{\"text\":\"Click here\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"476DF733E6E2DA51\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Occultism chapter\"]}},\" to see Occultism's quest line for more details.\"]
Not a Trampoline
I loved their Blue Album
The &bSqueezer&r squeezes fluids out of items and/or crushes them for processing. To do so, place an item inside and then &6repeatedly jump on it&r until it's done.

Resulting fluids and items are pushed into a tank or inventory on either channeled side of the Squeezer. If it isn't emptied, you can't squeeze another item. &6Reset the Squeezer with a redstone signal.&r
Notably, there are tales of people &6using armor stands to avoid manual labor...&r
Balanced Sifting
Under da sea!
Sifters that are &6waterlogged&r sometimes produce alternative resources.
Hint: To waterlog a sifter without a bucket, you must place it into a block of water.
Not this again...
At least it's not lava.
Fishing can &onet&r you &6all kinds of treasures&r, from food to Enchanted Books.
Casting a reel into water over and over may be relaxing to some, but pure torture to others.
To help you on your journey, we've included the handy-dandy &eCyclic&r &bFishing Net&r! Just insert your Fishing Rod, and it'll handle the rest.
The only problem is that &cit spits the loot over the entire water surface&r, rather than collecting it in an inventory. An &6Item Collector&r would be very helpful.
Fishing is also a good source of &bInk Sacks&r and &bCoral&r
A seedy place
Ex Terra
Sifting Dirt has a chance of producing &bPasture Seeds&r, which can &6turn Dirt into Grass&r.
Using Bone Meal on Grass can grow a variety of &6flowers, seeds, and roots&r.
Wandering traders can sell GMO chicken feed which you can feed to chickens to get a golden egg to make &6Delightful Dirt&r, which makes passive mobs spawn MUCH faster.
Moulding your future
Various &6Spores&r may be obtained from Sifting.
Sifting Dirt may yield &bMycelium Spores&r which, when used on Dirt, convert it into Mycelium.
Various other Spores can be obtained from &6Crushed Netherrack&r, once you're able to supply it.
Events
Fun little things that can happen
The pack uses a system called &eEvents&r, where things can randomly happen sometimes. All events are enabled by default.
You can toggle them with the &b/events toggle&r command. Typing that will also show you a list of each.
The events with a mob in the name (&6ftbskies:frog&r, &6:animal&r, &6:wandering_trader&r etc) just cause that mob to spawn occasionally.
Some, like &6:tea&r and &6:stick&r are just fun little nonsense events, which are inconsequential.

[\"\",\"Some, like \",{\"text\":\"ftbskies:amethyst\",\"color\":\"light_purple\",\"clickEvent\":{\"action\":\"change_page\",\"value\":\"5DF3A9F48D916AF0\"},\"hoverEvent\":{\"action\":\"show_text\",\"contents\":[\"Budding Amethyst quest\"]}},\" are integral to progression, so beware.\"]
Andestined for greatness
With the improved &bAndesite Mesh&r, you're able to collect &6more varied resources&r from the Sifter.
I'm twerked about Twerk.
Squat no grow :(
Dancing around your trees &cdoesn't seem to encourage growth&r, contrary to all standard botanical knowledge.
Luckily, there are plentiful sources of &6Bone Meal&r! Either make some in a &bComposter&r, or sift it from Dust.
Get Sugar Cane
&bSugar Cane&r is used in several important early recipes. If your island doesn't spawn with any, you can &6Sift&r some!
Thanks to &eApotheosis&r, Sugar Cane can grow to new heights!
Liquid Fire
Getting Lava by hopping on a Squeezer is &ca bit time consuming&r. Once you've gotten a source of power, look into the &6Mechanical Squeezer&r or the &6Magma Crucible&r.

If you wish to proceed with getting lava in the Mixing Cauldron, you will need 2 buckets of blood, so that the conversion of the first bucket of blood with the 8 stone, produces 1 rock, the second bucket is then converted to Lava.
Alternatively, you could &6automate Dripstone&r! If it's hanging from a block that has Lava above, it'll &6fill the Cauldron below&r!
Starting Your Island
How to start
Going through the ship's portal will allow you to &6choose a starting island&r, create an &eFTB Teams&r party, and send you there.

If you wish to &6play with a friend&r, &6join their party&r! Ask them to invite you to their party, or invite them to yours! (the button is at the top right of the &6My Teams&r menu in the inventory).
You can teleport back to your party's island using the &6/ftbdim home&r command, and visit others with &6/tpa&r.
The &bAnnotated Codex&r will allow you to share any glyphs you've learned in Ars Nouveau with your friends.
Less to render means less to lag!
&dFTB Skies&r comes with &eOculus&r, a mod which allows you to use &6shaders&r!
Alongside it, &eComplementary Reimagined&r has been included. To enable it, simply take a visit to your &6graphics settings&r and turn it on!
Throwing Shade
The akashic tome contains most of the books that various mods will use in the pack.
Sneak and right-clicking will let you browse and select any book contained within. To add more books, simply combine the tome with any other book in a crafting grid.
Join or Create a team Island
Craft some of the chunks you dug up into gravel to make flint.
This can be done by looking up how to make flint in JEI.
The flint hatchet won't last long, but it should be enough to get you started chopping down some trees to make better tools.

You know the drill; break trees, make things. Make a crafting table to get started delving into the recipes ahead. For your convenience we've added it to a stick! Enjoy. Also check out the &eCrafting Station&r which can use adjacent inventories and retain items.
The mixing cauldron takes exactly 8 input items and a liquid and produces a new item. It will also convert any &bremaining liquid&r into a new liquid type.
This means that a recipe, that requires &b&l1000mb of liquid to craft&r and has &6&l1000mb of liquid as output&r, needs to have atleast 2000mb of liquid inside, before you input the items

&bBiomass&r is needed to get into producing peat for the material generator. This will be your first form of FE production and peat will remain useful throughout the game later for methane byproducts.

The create &bmixer&r can combine many different varieties of fluids and items to combine them into something new. Your first uses will be for biomass and Primitive Slurry but you'll find many more uses for it. It's not a bad idea to make a couple of these.
When making Primitive Slurry, make sure the Blaze Burner is lit &bbefore&r putting the Gravel in, or it will just make flint instead of Primitive Slurry.
