ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests5.subtitle: And my axe!
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests5.descript: &bChopping Tools&r are needed in many recipes.
The easiest way to make one is to simply &6replace the Axe Head&r on a vanilla Iron Axe with another Iron Axe Head.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests6.title: Diamond Shortblade
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests6.subtitle: Tier 4 Cutting Tool
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests6.descript: Many advanced recipes need a &bTier 3+ Short Blade&r to act as a cutting tool.
The easiest way to make one is by taking a &6vanilla Diamond Sword&r and swapping out the blade with a &6Diamond Shortblade&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests7.subtitle: Enchanting with Tetra
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests7.descript: Tetra tools can be &6enchanted&r, either in the &bEnchanting Table&r or by installing an Enchanted Book onto a tool part.
Different parts have different &6magic capacity&r - it's best to &cavoid exceeding it&r, as it can have adverse effects...
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests8.title: Tool Leveling
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests8.subtitle: Take it to the limit!
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests8.descript: You'll notice in the Workbench menu, your tool has &6several stats important for upgrading it&r. These are Integrity, Honing, and Settling.
&bSettling&r is the easiest, and happens naturally over time. As you &6use the tool&r, it will gradually settle. A fully settled tool has a &6lower integrity cost&r.
&bHoning&r is increased the same way, but will &6boost a tool part&r when honed.

&bIntegrity&r is basically the &6maximum overall complexity&r of the tool. Better tool parts have higher integrity cost, and you &ccannot exceed max&r. Increasing Settling and Honing will allow for more Integrity to be used.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests9.subtitle: Get a Thermal Cell
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests9.descript: &bThermal Cells&r can be installed on two sides of the Forge Hammer to &6power it&r, allowing for higher tier tools and weapons.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests10.descrip: In order to progress beyond T4 tools, you'll need several new devices. First and foremost is the &bForge Hammer&r.

Normally, you'd find these hidden deep underground, but that's not really an option here. Instead, &6purchase one from a Tier 5 Armorer Villager&r. Place a Blast Furnace to set the Villager's profession.
The Forge Hammer must be placed &62 blocks above the Workbench&r.
The Forge Hammer can have &6upgrades&r installed. Use a &6Claw&r tool to remove them.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests11.descrip: To reach &6Tier 7&r, the Forge Hammer alone isn't enough.
You'll need to upgrade it with both the &bCombustion Chamber&r as well as the &bLubricant Dispenser&r.
ftbquests.chapter.tetra.quests12.descrip: &bScrolls&r, which can be found in chests in villages, &6unlock new crafting options in the Workbench&r when placed nearby.
Multiple Scrolls can be placed in the same block.
ftbquests.chapter.thermal_expansion.ques: This is just a dull hull
The next step up of our Pity Machine Frames are these Machine Frames.
They need some Steel Components and some Compressed Iron and open up various Pneumaticcraft and Thermal Machines
(Almost) all &eThermal Expansion&r machines are crafted using &bMachine Frames&r.
Microwave
Fossil Fuels are so 2018.
The &bRedstone Furnace&r allows you to use FE to smelt items instead.
Crushinator
The &bPulverizer&r &6crushes items&r.
Macrowave
The &bInduction Furnace&r is used to &6combine materials into alloys&r.
Random Thermal Alloy
SAWMILL! SAWMILL!
The &bSawmill&r allows you to &6get more Planks from Logs&r!
Also gives Sawdust!
Air Conditionern't
The &bMagma Crucible&r will be able to &6melt items into fluids&r.
Air Conditioner
The &bBlast Chiller&r &6freezes fluids into blocks&r.
Hydroponic
Using a &bPhytogenic Insulator&r will &6grow crops and plants in its inventory&r.
There are various optional fertilizers you can give it to make it work faster.
Upgrade your Machines!
&bIntegral Components&r are crucial to making your Machines more effective.
They scale your &6Thermal Expansion&r Machines by the number shown in the Tooltip.
&bReinforced Integral Components&r will make your machines even faster.
These will Speed up machines threefold.
With some Enderium and Lumium you can make some &bResonant Integral Components&r.
These are the last upgrade and will make your Machine scale up to 4x its speed.
Make a Machine Augment
Thermal machines can have various &bAugments&r installed onto them, changing their function in some way.
Some simply make it work faster or more efficiently, while others add new functions entirely.
Machine Augments
Even FASTER!

Beyond Enderium there are several super advanced alloys which can allow you to accelerate your thermal machines to new heights. As you're able to, invest in some of these new alloys to enjoy new levels of efficiency!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.title: To the Stars!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests0.d: The &bNASA Workbench&r is used to &6craft Rockets&r.
There are &6four tiers&r; naturally, you have to make the first one first.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests1.d: Once you've crafted your &bRocket&r, place it down on a &bLaunchpad&r.
Sneak right-click a placed Rocket to open its GUI. Here, you can insert &6Fuel&r and insert up to 8 items for it to store.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests2.d: The &bFuel Refinery&r converts &6Oil&r into &6Fuel&r, for use in Rockets.
You can get Oil either using the &6Fluid Drill&r from &eIndustrial Foregoing&r, or through &eProductive Bees&r.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests3.d: It's a little-known fact that &cyou can't breathe in space&r. Well, you &ocan&r, but only out, and only once.
A &bSpace Suit&r is incredibly useful to have, as it keeps the air in and the space out. Also works under water!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests4.d: The &bOxygen Loader&r is used to &6pull Oxygen from Water&r.
Give it Water, either through pipes or Buckets, and provide it with FE power.
You can take the converted Oxygen out by filling &6Buckets&r, &6Oxygen Tanks&r, or a &6Space Suit&r. Using an Oxygen Tank will fill your Space Suit.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests5.d: • It costs &6three buckets of Fuel&r to launch a Rocket. Make sure you have enough for a return trip!
• &6Bring a Launch Pad&r with you! You can't launch without one.
• When you reach your destination, you'll be in a &6freefalling Lander&r. &cHold space to slow down!&r
• You will &6land at the same coordinates you launched from&r, just in a different dimension.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests6.s: I can see my house from here!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests6.d: If you have the proper materials in your inventory, you can make a &bSpace Station&r orbitting one of the major astral bodies.
Basically, it's an &6expandable skyblock structure&r, which generates at the same coordinates you launched from.
Completing either task will complete the quest.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests7.d: &bThe Moon&r is a barren wasteland, (mostly) devoid of life.
Underground, you can find &6Desh Ore&r, which is integral to progression.
You can also rarely find &6dungeons&r and &6Lunarian villages&r!
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests8.d: The &bFuel Loader&r will &6automatically fuel Rockets&r within 2 blocks of itself.
ftbquests.chapter.to_the_stars.quests9.d: The &bRover&r is a vehicle, powered by Fuel, that lets you &6quickly explore&r.
With access to Desh, you can make the &bTier 2 Rocket&r.
There's no natural life, no dungeons, and only a single featureless structure to be found.
It's also the only known source of &6Ostrum&r, a highly heat-resistant material.
The &bTier 3 Rocket&r can take you to both &bMercury&r and &6Venus&r!
The &bCryo Freezer&r converts &6Ice Shards&r (which can be found as an ore on cold planets) into &6Cryo Fuel&r.
&6A single bucket of Cryo Fuel&r can fuel a Rocket trip!
The &bNetherite Space Suit&r provides &6complete heat resistence&r, which is a strict requirement for Mercury and Venus.
Space is just chock full of barren wastelands. &bMercury&r and &bVenus&r are two more examples of such.
Due to their proximity to the sun, a &6Netherite Space Suit&r is required to not &cburn up&r.
The &bTier 4 Rocket&r provides access to the Proxima Centauri star system, which currently only contains the planet &bGlacio&r.
The &bJet Suit&r is the final tier of Space Suit. In addition to providing oxygen, this one also provides &6flight&r!
While powered with FE, hold space to fly, and hold space and control to boost like an Elytra.
With a &6Tier 1 Rocket&r, you can &bfly to the End&r!
ftbquests.chapter.travel.title: Gadgets + Gizmos
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests0.title: Item Collector
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests0.descrip: The &bItem Collector&r collects nearby item drops. There are many alternatives, so pick your favorite.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests1.title: Wireless Transmission of Power!
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests1.descrip: &eFlux Networks&r allows you to &6wirelessly transfer FE&r at massive speeds, as well as &6charge your inventory&r from any distance.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests2.descrip: &bFlux Storage&r blocks store FE on the network.
You cannot connect to them with pipes, only using Flux Points and Plugs.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests3.descrip: &bFlux Points&r serve as the &6outputs&r of a network.
If there's FE on the network, or if there's a Flux Plug receiving FE, it will be sent out of Points on the network.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests4.descrip: &bFlux Plugs&r serve as the &6input&r to a network.
In order to use it, you'll have to &6create a network&r and then connect to it.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests5.descrip: The &bFlux Controller&r allows you to &6enable inventory charging&r, using FE on the network.
You can set it to charge your hotbar, curio, armor, and hand slots.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests6.descrip: The &bTemporal Pouch&r will &6passively store time&r while it's in your inventory.
You can spend this time by using it on a block, &6rapidly accelerating it&r. Click multiple times to make it even faster.

You can get a nautilus shell to craft this from fishing in a minimum of 5x5x5 of water to trigger the treasure tables. A fishing rod with luck of the sea will improve your odds. The Cyclic Fisher in incapable of getting these but the Industrial Forgoing one can. Prismarine Bees may also be of some assistance here.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests7.title: Soaring through the skies
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests7.descrip: Occasionally, a &6Wandering Trader&r may make their way to your island (Or can be summoned).
If you provide the right payment of moon dust, you might be able to &bbuy what allows them to traverse&r the sky...
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests8.descrip: The &bPersonalized Shrinking Device&r allows you to &6change your size&r!
With it, you can transform from 20% of your normal size, to 1000%!
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests9.descrip: The Crafting Table does the job, sure, but this is modded! We can do better!
The &bCrafting Station&r can &6access adjacent inventories&r, and your items stay inside if you leave them!
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests10.descri: &bJetpacks&r from &eMekanism&r use Hydrogen gas to allow you to &6fly when worn&r. Simply hold jump to boost upward!
The armored version is much better protection than the basic version but more costly.
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests11.title: Powerful Anvils
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests11.descri: &eCyclic&r has provided us with some powerful Anvils
&bPowered Anvil&r - Will repair your items with Energy
&4Magmatic Anvil&r - Will repair your items with Lava
&7Void Anvil&r - Strips your items of their Enchants and returns some liquid EXP
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests12.title: 99 Bottles of lava on the wall... wait...
ftbquests.chapter.travel.quests12.descri: Lets be honest, we've all made the 16x16x40 \"tank\" enough times. Here is a &eCreative Lava Tank&r to use instead. Your server owners will thank you.
ftbquests.chapter.vi__into_the_unknown.q: A long hard journey finally comes to it's completion.
Craft your frosty &bPiña Colada&r, kick back on a lawn chair at sun set and drink your frosty beverage to be transported to a tropical paradise with nothing but fond memories of your labors.
On behalf of the Entire FTB Team, Thank you for playing and &6congratulations!&r
We hope you enjoyed the journey!
If you want to go full completionist you can attempt to additionally finish the &bOverpowered&r Questline!
You'll need some purpur blocks for this, you can get them from the Lord of Darkness Bee or by pushing into the Super Critical Phase shifter.

The microfusion extrapolator is a more efficient way to make nuclear fuels. Utilizing radiation in the surrounding area it can purify the environment while concentrating the nuclear radiation back into a fissile atomic structure from lead.
ftbquests.chapter.v_2.title: V - Deep Freeze
ftbquests.chapter.v_2.quests5.descriptio: Using a Thermal Evaporation tower you'll need to create ultramafic lava using lava. This super heated lava is useful for several high end crafting processes.
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.title: Welcome
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.subtitle: Beyond the skies!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quests0.title: Welcome to FTB Skies!
ftbquests.chapter.welcome.quests0.descri: Welcome back to &dFTB Skies&r, our skyblock pack for 1.19.2 that has now been taken to all new heights.

&6These quests are optional&r but will help navigate the recipes and mechanical changes without them can be incredibly difficult. We suggest you use this as a guide to take you through your adventures in our skyblock world.
The far left of the quest book has the &6chapter list&r.
Most resource aquisition can be found through JEI but the questbook will assist you in reaching the other dimensions and, launching your rocket to the stars above!
&bWe hope you enjoy the journey ahead... You are in for a challenge and we're here for that!&r
